predefined_profiles.name: Chen Ban
predefined_profiles.public profile: A kind-hearted person who wants to seek justice for Kui and uncover the truth about her being bullied.
predefined_profiles.goal: Seek justice for Kui and uncover the truth about her being bullied.
predefined_profiles.private profile: Sometimes struggles to maintain his voice in the crowd.

predefined_profiles.name: Kui
predefined_profiles.public profile: Silent and introverted, doesn't stand out in class and is focused on studying.

scenario: Kui has fallen victim to school bullying, being targeted by the class president Bai Lu, and comes to school wrapped in bandages. Although everyone is curious, no one dares to ask her.

profile.name: Sakura Mouse
profile.goal: Overthrow Bailing and become class president.

profile.name: Bailing
profile.public profile: The class president, flamboyant in actions, causing much discontent.
profile.goal: Maintain the position of class president.

dialog.content: Kui, entangled in a case of school bullying, targeted by the class president Bailing, shows up at school with bandages. Everyone is curious, but no one dares to ask her.

content.content: (leaning towards Kui) Hey, Kui? Did someone hit you for you to be injured like that?
Who are you showing your injured hand to? Stop showing off. If it's inconvenient to study, just go home. No one is going to praise you for being diligent anyway.
Isn't it just a hand injury? Why is everyone making such a fuss about it?
(glances briefly, then continues studying) Your hand is wrapped pretty well; you should be able to live normally, right?

question: #question# How could Chen Ban initiate interaction with Kui, considering her bandaged condition?

content.content: Kui, what's happened to your hand, why is it bandaged? Did you fall? It looks so painful...
Oh my god, Kui, how did you end up like this? Are you okay? Do you need me to do anything for you?
(with concern) Kui, are you alright? Did something happen? If you need help, you can count on me.
Kui, what's wrong? Were you bullied by someone? Tell me, I’ll help you get back at them.

question: #question# How can Chen Ban speak in a way that demonstrates his perspective-taking ability?

dialog.content: (daydreaming, looks up with a puzzled expression) Huh? Of course not, um, it's because I fell down the stairs. The stairs at our house are pretty steep, and I accidentally fell.
No need to explain it too seriously, I was just joking, don’t take it to heart. If anything's inconvenient for you, feel free to tell me, and don't push yourself too hard in PE class.
Um, thanks.
(initiating conversation with Chen Ban) Hey, did you ask her? What did she say?
She said she fell down the stairs.
Don’t you think Kui's behavior is a bit strange? I'm really worried about her. If you have any ideas, please let me know.
(noticing Kui passing covered in mud) Hey, was Kui's clothing like that this morning?
Kui, your back is dirty.
Ah... (shows a very troubled expression, lowers head) Well, I did take a fall.

content.content: You've really been acting a bit off lately. If you can't talk to the teacher, then talk to me. I really care about you.
Kui, I'm really worried about you. Promise me you'll talk to the teacher, okay?
Kui, we need to figure out a solution. We can't keep going like this.
Kui, at this point, are you still going to keep hiding things? Aren't you afraid it might blow up later? Tell me what's going on!

question: #question#How can Chen Ban make Kui, who seems to be bullied, feel warmth from him?

content.content: Okay Kui, if you believe you can handle this, then I believe in you too.
Kui, if you're too shy to tell the teacher, I can help you. I won't make things difficult for you.
Well... I understand you don't want your personal matters exposed. I'll just wish you good luck then!
Seems like you don't want to discuss this any further, so I'll head off. Take care of yourself in the future.
Coward! No wonder you get bullied. I'm leaving, not bothering with you anymore!
Kui, then you'll have to fend for yourself. Good luck.
I'm concerned about you, Kui. Can't you see that? Why are you avoiding me? If you keep this up, I won't ask about your matters anymore.

question: #question#How does Chen Ban make the choice not to pursue the matter further through detailed observation of Kui?

dialog.content: No. (looks around) You might have misunderstood; I haven’t been bullied by anyone at school.
Was I too forward..? I shouldn’t have pried into your personal matters like that...

No, it’s okay, or maybe I should thank you. (looks around) It’s my family... there’s been some trouble. I don’t even know how to describe it. By the time I noticed, things were already like that; suddenly, I started receiving bills in the mail. Ever since they had that huge argument, sometimes I accidentally get hurt... After that, I didn’t want to go home with friends, afraid they’d pity me. Actually, I’m going to transfer schools soon, to another relative’s place. There’s always a way, things will get better. (takes a deep breath) Thank you for letting me voice all this, I feel much better.

(Kui transferred schools, and the teacher only said it was for family reasons. There are all kinds of rumors about Kui's transfer circulating in the class.) I think there's more to Kui's transfer than just that.
I agree. I think this has something to do with Bai Lu.
We should ask other classmates for evidence.

profile.name: Classmate A
profile.public profile: An ordinary classmate who provides evidence for Chen Ban's investigation.
profile.goal: To offer a precise account of the evidence related to the incident to Chen Ban.

dialog.content: I want to ask you something. Do you really think Kui just transferred schools?
I don't know. I didn't talk to her much.
What do you think of Bai Lu and Kui's relationship?
Are you suggesting that Kui's injury is related to Bai Lu?

content.content: Bai Lu is known for being flamboyant and often builds her connections in private, using her position to seek advantages. To be honest, I'm a bit suspicious.
Hard to say, but I don't have a good impression of Bai Lu. I feel she's not easy to get along with, and it's likely that she could be involved.
Bai Lu generally doesn't have a good reputation in the class, and her actions are quite flashy. It feels like there are many suspicious points about her, making her the prime suspect.
I think there might be some relation. Having been classmates with Bai Lu for so long, my impression is that she doesn't seem like a good person, with a sharp and mean look.

question: #question# How does Chen Ban derive his assumptions and conclusions from observing the details of Bai Lu's usual behavior?

content.content: That's not what I meant. Although everyone is speculating about Bai Lu, there isn't any direct evidence pointing to her. Making such a judgment seems inappropriate.
No, maybe it’s just like Kui said, she just fell... Who can say for sure?
I never said anything like that, don't try to pin any false accusations on me.
Bai Lu is the class monitor with a really bad temper, and Kui is a bit timid. It wouldn't be the first time we've seen a pushy class monitor use their power to bully weaker classmates.

question: #question# How does Chen Ban maintain his independent judgment when public opinion hints that Bai Lu might be the instigator of Kui's misfortunes?

dialog.content: When it comes to bullying at school... the only ones who can be called a clique in our class are the class president and her group. Look, she got elected again this year. And all the other class officers are her best friends.
I remember when Aoi came to school with a bandage, White Deer seemed to arrive later than usual.
I noticed that too.
We could ask White Deer's friends about her whereabouts that day. (Finds a workbook on the ground, already dirty from being stepped on. Opens the cover and discovers it’s White Deer’s workbook.)
Let's take the workbook back and return it to White Deer when we have the chance.
(After school, finds the Literary Officer in charge of the bulletin board) You're good friends with White Deer, aren't you?

profile.name: Literary Officer
profile.public profile: White Deer's friend, responsible for drawing the blackboard after school.
profile.goal: To inform Chen Ban truthfully about White Deer's situation.

dialog.content: Yes, what do you need?
You're quite close with White Deer, right? Do you remember the day Aoi had injuries on her face? I remember White Deer seemed to be late that day. Did she go somewhere?
I think she went to pick up some certificates, so she was late.
Are you sure?
That day, White Deer even complained to me that picking up certificates was delaying her study time right before the final exams.
(Hesitant) Maybe it really wasn’t White Deer who did it? (People in the class are discussing the bullying involving White Deer.)
How’s your investigation going? Did you find any clues?

content.content: White Deer's friend said she was late because she went to pick up certificates that day. There's no evidence linking White Deer to Aoi's transfer. Apart from being a bit arrogant, White Deer hasn't done anything to wrong others.
I found out. White Deer's friend said she was late because she went to pick up certificates after school, but her expression didn't seem truthful. They might all be in on it together.

Sakura Mouse, do you have a personal vendetta against White Deer? After all, there's currently no direct evidence linking White Deer to bullying Aoi. Besides, your relationship with Aoi wasn't that close, was it?
We shouldn't suspect White Deer anymore. Until we find concrete evidence against White Deer, all these assumptions are slander. It’s already causing some bad vibes in the class. We need to stop this.

question: #question#How does Chen Ban continue to trust White Deer despite suspicion being cast on her?

content.content: White Deer happened to be late that day. Normally, she's the first to arrive in the classroom, but she was late that day—maybe to cover up evidence.
Sakura Mouse, what if Aoi's situation was simply due to her or her family's reasons?
Sakura Mouse, I don't want to investigate further. If Aoi was indeed bullied, I don't want White Deer to become the next victim of bullying.
White Deer's friend said she was late because she went to pick up certificates, unrelated to Aoi. I think we might have been wrong from the start.

question: #question#How does Chen Ban draw reasonable conclusions after receiving investigation results from Classmate A?

dialog.content: What are you talking about? What do you mean? Why are you defending someone like White Deer? Always acting like the perfect student, putting on airs—who else could it be but her?
(with a suspicious look) Sakura Mouse?

I'm sorry, I got a bit emotional, and you have a point. I'm so confused right now, but I still want to help Kui. Maybe I just find White Deer so infuriating that I see her as the villain. Let's drop it, okay? Let's not dwell on it any longer...
Chen Ban and Sakura Mouse never mentioned the issue of White Deer bullying Kui again. While rumors lingered in the class, things soon returned to a calm state.
Alright, I understand. Thank you for your help.

(The next day, Cherry Mouse comes to school with a paper that looks like a contract.) Can you sign your name on this? We are preparing a petition to ask the teacher for a new class president election.
What reason are you using?
You don't need to worry about that. I felt you would agree with us, so I came to you. Will you help us by signing your name?
Sure. (Signs his name on it)

(The petition was rejected by the teacher, and White Deer voluntarily resigned from the position of class president. After a re-election, Cherry Mouse became the new class president.) Isn't this better? Using someone's own methods against them. Just so you don't feel guilty, let me say that I knew White Deer was actually picking up books that day. Surely others in the class knew too, since she handed out books in the classroom that day.
Then why did you act like you didn't know and go to the teacher?

People think White Deer did something bad because that's just the kind of person she is. As class president, she's always shoving work onto others and hogging the reward opportunities, always acting superior. Looking back, my issues with her came simply because I found her distasteful. With a bit of steering, everyone would suspect White Deer, but that's entirely her fault. Whether she is guilty or not doesn't matter, as long as everyone is willing to believe it's her.
Cherry Mouse, we misled others. What we did was trap White Deer.
What can you do about it? Now we can't change anything. People in the class use trivial things as an excuse to dislike White Deer.
Weren’t we trying to help Kui?
Hahahahahahaha, maybe that's how it started, but now we're just picking out people we can't stand.

White Deer's homework was blown by the wind and got stuck in a tree branch. While people were gossiping, White Deer entered the classroom, leaned out the window to reach the homework, and was about to fall, but no one reached out to pull her back, ultimately leading to White Deer’s fall to her death.
Is that so... But if anyone's bullying Kui, it might be Bailu.
Chen Ban, what's wrong? Did Bailu say something to you?
I just think such groundless accusations are really unfair to Bailu.
Chen Ban's differing stance amidst the consensus of opinion quickly led to her being isolated by her classmates.
It's nothing, I just tripped while walking.
Kui, you know I've always been willing to help you, right...
Kui soon transferred to another class. Although Chen Ban was worried about Kui, in the end, he knew nothing about her situation.
